name: lizjones
text: The look on Philippe's face is priceless.

name: flynn
text: It is worth at least 5.00 SmileBucks%u2122

name: saint
text: those last three panels as a whole make the whole strip!

name: peterjoel
text: Philippe has no way of getting any money, ever.

name: pie4me6
text: Maybe he should commit suicide!

name: haruspex
text: But how? QUESTION MARK

name: woodenteeth
text: You have grammatically appropriate Tourettes and I find it highly amusing. Now say "..."

name: blarghamagarky
text: he got dressed up to get yelled at

name: soticoto
text: By all rights he is (or would be) the president... He has to look the part.

name: petitegitan
text: I believe that the SmileBucks had the opposite affect that Philippe intended.

name: hollis
text: Yes.  But as always, he meant well.

name: whitey
text: Once again the panels without dialogue pay dividends.

name: deancain29
text: the above was me agreeing with no dialogue

name: thatskotkid
text: Proving once again that context kicks content's ass, any day.  Thanks, postmodernism!

name: widdershins
text: thostmodernism!

name: semiquaver
text: thothtmoderithm.

name: stuart
text: I keep a OneNote page for stupid things to say to my friends. I am right now adding "Thants does not work well with Postmodernism"

name: trevor
text: Wait, so I can redeem SmileBucks(tm) for nude pictures of Sandra Bullock?

name: the_doz
text: If it had been nude pictures of Meg White, this might have played out differently.

name: mastronaut
text: I'm all for the Genuine* Rolex** watches.

name: epicurus
text: I once owned a *hatented* Rolex watch from a street vendor in Nepal. I treasure it always.

name: gournal
text: What does that mean??

name: gournal
text: Oh god, I thought that it said *haunted* Rolex watch, got really confused, got really excited for your explanation, and now I am just sad.

name: dybrar
text: Nepalese magical realism.

name: darthemed
text: Who has not felt the shame of a poorly chosen credit card transaction?

name: yacoon
text: A comment left by yacoon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ishuta, Bourbonsamurai, blarghamagarky)

name: andrew_
text: his screen name is Phillipe!

name: stuart
text: exclamation point and all

name: soticoto
text:
Negatory.
One L.

name: werewolves
text: He is five.

name: slalvation
text: It's so sad. It's like when your kid sister thinks she could really win an iPod from a banner ad.

name: heccibiggs
text: I'm sensing a true story here.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
one of my friends actually got a video jpod from one of those fakeroni deals.

that is a true story.

name: dumase
text: Phillipe thought it was a smile emergency.

name: smashley
text:
Hey guys! Guess who just got...


yelllled aaat!

name: hrm
text: Instead of check boxes, the "I am interested in" section has radio buttons, thus making the items impossible to deselect: a clever scam.

name: direhaggis
text: Well, did you?

name: drago25
text: Definitely one of my favourite Phillipe strips

name: charchar
text: Man, I actually did this in like the second grade but please don't tell my friends.

name: heccibiggs
text:
You were on the internet in the second grade? How young are you?

What age are you in second grade, anyway? I would figure it to be about 7. I'm 19 and I was first online when I was 10, and I was one of the earlier out of my friends.

name: charchar
text: Second grade is seven years old.  I am 17.  Actually, now that you mention it, it was probably later in my young, internet-impaired life (I think that actually makes it worse that I was probably nine or ten.) I just remember getting yelled at.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Guess who at a young age got...

YELLED AAAT!

name: fineoakstructure
text: Internet in second grade?  You kids are growin' up in a different world than the one I came up in, you know?

name: charchar
text: True-  I saw this girl the other talking on a cell and she couldn't have been more than 10.  I was shocked, then meta-shocked at  my shock.  Who needs a cell phone at that age? "Uh, yeah, you know, I've gotta manage my offshore accounts from the see-saw to the Scouts' meeting."  What.  the. hell.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i have been on the internet since Prodigy didn't have pictures. long live that old account. i still remember that username, too!

so rad.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: and that year would be like...'92. yay for developing reading skills super early!

name: relaxing
text: This is the meaning of the dot-com crash.

name: echidnaboy
text: I'm resisting the urge to click frantically just to the left of T's head in panel 4.

name: saulbellow
text: Teodor, grow up and get it done, son!
